block.p: New interpretations of classic cocktails will be demonstrated and available for sampling tomorrow from 6 to 8 p.m. at Pour, 321 Amsterdam Avenue (75th Street). The cost is $10: (212) 501-7687.

To celebrate the birthday of Thomas Jefferson on Friday at 6:30 p.m., Pasanella & Son, 115 South Street (Peck Slip), will hold a tasting of Madeiras, one of his favorite drinks. The cost is $40: (212) 233-8383.
For help in sorting out the terminology used for rieslings in Germany, there will be a free tasting and discussion on Saturday from 2 to 5 p.m. at Acker Merrall & Condit, 160 West 72nd Street.
A five-course spring dinner paired with rieslings will be held on Monday at 6:30 p.m. at Beacon Restaurant, 25 West 56th Street. The cost is $125 including tax and tip: (212) 332-0500.

Wine Rave, an event that seeks to make tasting and learning about wine fun and accessible, will be held on April 20 from 6 to 10 p.m., and on the 21st from 5 to 10 p.m. at Guastavino's, 409 East 59th Street. Tickets are $65, or $100 for priority admission to seminars, and access to a lounge with cheese and other snacks. (212) 352-9900 or wineravenyc.com. Tickets will also be sold at the door.
